title: DashScope: Implement new chat api
body:
## Issue
Closes #29 

## Change
Implement new chat api. And refactor generate(...) methods with the new chat(...) method.


## General checklist
<!-- Please double-check the following points and mark them like this: [X] -->
- [X] There are no breaking changes
- [X] I have added unit and integration tests for my change
- [X] I have manually run all the unit tests in _all_ modules, and they are all green
- [ ] I have manually run all integration tests in the module I have added/changed, and they are all green
author: jiangsier-xyz

comments.body: @jiangsier-xyz Thank you! Could you please add some tests using new chat API?

> @jiangsier-xyz Thank you! Could you please add some tests using new chat API?

Since generate(...) has already been re-implemented by chat(...), the old tests can be used to validate it.

Additionally, QwenChatModelIT and QwenStreamingChatModelIT have been made to inherit from AbstractChatModelIT and AbstractStreamingChatModelIT, respectively. They provide more test cases for the new chat API.

Also, some tests have been added for the qwen-specified parameters.
It looks like the build issue has nothing to do with this PR.

> It looks like the build issue has nothing to do with this PR.

@jiangsier-xyz Yeah, the build issue is because the snapshot release of main repo and `langchain4j-spring`. I'm waiting it fixed and then review this PR. Thank you for you patience!

The test failed, @jiangsier-xyz Could you please check?


> The test failed, @jiangsier-xyz Could you please check?

After a few changes, I ran only the new tests...

Fixed now.

And, some of the test failures were caused by the dashscope service not being able to access the wiki. Still no suitable way to deal with it.

> @jiangsier-xyz Thank you! Maybe the `langchain4j-community-dashscope-spring-boot-starter` also need some updates.

Supported configuration for new qwen parameters.
@jiangsier-xyz Thank you! Could you please remove `lombok` in `langchain4j-community-dashscope-spring-boot-starter`?

> @jiangsier-xyz Thank you! Could you please remove `lombok` in `langchain4j-community-dashscope-spring-boot-starter`?

Done.

title: [BUG] The Vearch Create Space Cannot Set replica_num
body:
<!-- Please provide as many details as possible, this will help us to deliver a fix as soon as possible. Thank you! -->

## Describe the bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->

```
private void createSpace(String databaseName, String space) {
        vearchClient.createSpace(
                databaseName,
                CreateSpaceRequest.builder()
                        .name(space)
                        .replicaNum(1)
                        .partitionNum(1)
                        .fields(vearchConfig.getFields())
                        .build());
    }
```

## Log and Stack trace
<!-- Please provide a log and a stack trace (with exception), if applicable. -->

## Minimal Example to Reproduce
<!-- Please provide a relevant code snippets to reproduce this bug. -->

## Expected behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->

## Please complete the following information:
- LangChain4j Community version:  0.36.2
- LangChain4j Community Component you used (e.g. `langchain4j-community-clickhouse`):langchain4j-community-vearch
- Java version:  17
- Spring Boot version (if applicable):  3.2.4

## Additional context
<!-- Add any other context about the problem here. -->
the space will create with the default replicaNum(1) and  .partitionNum(1) , When your cluster has multiple replicas, high availability cannot be guaranteed. When the number of replica is set to 1
author: fanjia1024

title: DashScope: more clearly and strictly constrain messages ordering to fit the model requirements
body:
## Change
More clearly and strictly constrain messages ordering to fit the model requirements


## General checklist
<!-- Please double-check the following points and mark them like this: [X] -->
- [X] There are no breaking changes
- [X] I have added unit and integration tests for my change
- [X] I have manually run all the unit tests in _all_ modules, and they are all green
author: jiangsier-xyz

@Martin7-1 It looks like DashScope is reverted. I have all the tests passing locally.

title: Migrating langchain4j-chatglm
body:
<!--
Thank you so much for your contribution!

Please fill in all the sections below.
Please open the PR as a draft initially. Once it is reviewed and approved, we will ask you to add documentation and examples.
Please note that PRs with breaking changes or without tests will be rejected.

Please note that PRs will be reviewed based on the priority of the issues they address.
We ask for your patience. We are doing our best to review your PR as quickly as possible.
Please refrain from pinging and asking when it will be reviewed. Thank you for understanding!
-->

## Issue
<!-- Please specify the ID of the issue this PR is addressing. For example: "Closes #1234" or "Fixes #1234" -->
Closes #12 

## Change
<!-- Please describe the changes you made. -->

1. Migrating `langchain4j-chatglm` to `langchain4j-community-chatglm`
2. Remove deprecated `text()` call of `ChatMessage`.
3. Moving embedding stores and models to distinct dir.

## General checklist
<!-- Please double-check the following points and mark them like this: [X] -->
- [x] There are no breaking changes
- [x] I have added unit and integration tests for my change
- [x] I have manually run all the unit tests in _all_ modules, and they are all green
- [x] I have manually run all integration tests in the module I have added/changed, and they are all green

## Checklist for adding new maven module
<!-- Please double-check the following points and mark them like this: [X] -->
- [x] I have added my new module in the root `pom.xml` and `langchain4j-community-bom/pom.xml`
author: Martin7-1

comments.body: @Martin7-1 once you are done with migrating, could you please remove migrated modules from the main repo so that I don't accidentally release them? üôè

> @Martin7-1 once you are done with migrating, could you please remove migrated modules from the main repo so that I don't accidentally release them? üôè

@langchain4j OK. Will remove it once migrating all modules this week.

title: [FEATURE] SearXNG Support
body:
## Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. Ex. I'm always frustrated when [...] -->
SearXNG is a popular search engine aggregator that provides API access and is supported by the Langchain project but not Langchain4j

## Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you want to happen. -->
An implementation of web-search-engine that supports SearXNG similar to the current support for Google, Tavily and Search API

## Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered. -->
None

## Additional context
<!-- Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here. -->
None
author: bnayfeh

comments.body: @bnayfeh Hi! Thank you for your contribution. Noted that in `langchain4j-community`, the package name should be `dev.langchain4j.community.xxx.xxx`, and we do not want to introduce `lombok` in new integration :)

title: [FEATURE] Setup CI pipeline
body:
Setup CI pipeline with github-actions.
It should be done before we have any features are integrated
author: kpavlov

comments.body:
yeah...I'm working on it :)

But I'm new to it, could you please help me review this PR? Would be very appreciated! #4
